name: dart
content:
dart noun
(POINTED OBJECT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a small, thin object with a sharp point that is thrown by hand in a game, shot from a gun, or blown from a tube when used as a weapon Compare
arrow
chengyuzheng/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages darts [ U ]
a game in which darts are thrown at a circular board. The number of points won depends on where the darts land on the board: a game of darts

dart noun
(SEWN FOLD)
[ C ] a small fold, becoming narrower towards one end, that is sewn into a piece of clothing to make it fit better
AnnaRassadnikova/iStock/Getty Images Plus/Getty Images /GettyImages

dart noun
(QUICK MOVEMENT)
[ C usually singular ] a quick, sudden movement: We made a dart for (= moved quickly towards) the exit.

to move quickly or suddenly: I darted behind the sofa and hid. dart a glance/look at someone/something (also dart a glance/look somewhere)
to look quickly at someone or something, or to look quickly somewhere: She darted an angry look at me.

dart verb [I always + adv/prep]
(MOVE QUICKLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to move quickly or suddenly: She darted out from between two parked cars.
dart noun [C]
(POINTED OBJECT)
us

/dɑrt/ a small object with a thin pointed end that is thrown or shot: a tranquilizer dart

us/dɑrt/ a fold sewn into a piece of clothing to make it fit better
